properties.areaDesc: Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 5 at 1:40PM MST until January 7 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Blowing snow expected at higher elevations
and the passes. Total snow accumulations of 16 to 24 inches
through Marias Pass, 6 to 12 inches near Lincoln and Rogers
Pass, 8 to 12 inches near Babb and St. Mary, and 4 to 6 inches
near Browning. Winds to near 50 mph possible along the passes
and higher elevations, which may cause localized whiteout
conditions.

* WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front, Central and Southern
Lewis and Clark and Southern Rocky Mountain Front.

* WHEN...From noon Monday to 6 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on
young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local
Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY
